name: gloating
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
feeling or expressing great pleasure or satisfaction because of your own success or good luck, or someone else's failure or bad luck: The gloating expression in his eyes had been replaced by curiosity. He glanced at it, then at Michael, with a gloating expression. See
gloat
More examplesFewer examplesGloating gossip writers had jammed Scott and Annabel's home phones with their questions.We might as well enjoy ourselves while we can before they take their gloating revenge. The German brothers will silence their gloating critics.

expressions of great pleasure or satisfaction because of your own success or good luck, or someone else's failure or bad luck: Let's be gracious in victory - no gloating, no jeering.
More examplesFewer examplesThey reacted, not with gloating, but with shock.Any gloating over such a tragedy would be unthinkable.This gloating by the winning side does not do them any credit.There's nothing more irritating than parental gloating over a child's success.
